posts.title: My AI Dream Turned Nightmare: Where's the Human To...
posts.content:
My AI Dream Turned Nightmare: Where's the Human Touch When ChatGPT Goes Haywire and Your Work Vanishes?"
"Has anyone else felt that initial rush of excitement with AI, only to be slammed into a wall of utter frustration? I poured my heart and soul into writing my book using ChatGPT Plus. Honestly, it felt like I'd found a brilliant collaborator, a digital muse offering incredible suggestions. I was genuinely thrilled!"
"Then came the gut punch. A simple, human mistake ‚Äì creating two sections for my manuscript instead of one. Surely, I thought, merging them would be straightforward. But no. ChatGPT flatly told me it couldn't be done automatically. Fine, I gritted my teeth and started the tedious task of manual copy-pasting."
"Little did I know, this was the beginning of a digital meltdown. The sheer volume of my work choked the system. It demanded to be fed in tiny, agonizing chunks. And as I painstakingly pieced my book back together, something went horribly wrong."
"My co-author‚Ä¶ broke. It started spewing gibberish, mangling my carefully crafted sentences, and repeating the same nonsensical phrases over and over, like a broken toy. Ten precious days. Ten days of focused, dedicated work, now seemingly dissolving into digital dust. I pleaded with it, typed increasingly desperate messages, but it was like talking to a brick wall."
"The AI that had so brilliantly analyzed complex links and even YouTube videos was now utterly lost. In the end, heartbroken and defeated, I salvaged what I could from the earlier, coherent chats. This wasn't just about lost words; it was about lost time, lost momentum, and a profound sense of betrayal by a tool I had come to rely on."
"This ordeal laid bare a chilling reality: when AI goes wrong, you're utterly alone. There's no "undo" button for a confused algorithm, no customer support line to call for your digital co-author. It's a black hole of frustration."
"This isn't just a technical glitch; it's a fundamental flaw in the way we're building these powerful tools. Shouldn't there be a safety net? A way for a more stable AI or a human-guided system to step in when things go catastrophically wrong? Imagine an AI first-aid kit, a digital support team to rescue users from these nightmarish scenarios."
"My initial awe at AI's potential has been replaced by a stark awareness of its fragility and the profound lack of empathy in its current form. We hear so much about the power of AI, but who is talking about these jarring failures? How many others have poured their energy into these platforms only to watch their work crumble due to unforeseen AI limitations?"
"I'm sharing my story not just out of frustration, but with a genuine hope that we can start a crucial conversation. Let's move beyond the hype and demand more resilient, user-centric AI tools that offer a lifeline when the digital dream turns into a devastating nightmare. Please, share your own experiences. Are we alone in facing these AI challenges?"
"#AI #chatgpt

posts.title:
Beware of fraud on Amazon Online Shopping."
"Bewar...
posts.content:
Beware of fraud on Amazon Online Shopping."
"Beware of Amazon fraud. I'm a regular and loyal customer of Amazon. I ordered DJI MIC Wireless by order #171-2482211-9442727, which was delivered by the delivery agent of Amazon on 29th September, along with the other orders I placed. Somehow how, I was very busy in my day-to-day routine and opened the box this evening and got the shock of my life that the package had a Bluetooth speaker for Rs 300/. I put the reviews on Google but there is no fraud system on the Amazon website. I called the number 1800-1200-1571, which was picked up by a lady after a wait of 4 minutes. I'm so amazed that Amazon does not have any fraud reporting mechanism. I'm sure I'm not the only one who was frauded like this, but such a big company does not have anything called fraud on their website and a special number for this fraud system. A customer get wild to see his 22k got wasted in a jiffy. I would like to warn other customers through this blog to write in comments if they are also being cheated on Amazon."
"#amazon #fraud #jeffbezos

posts.title: As I sit here, reflecting on the whirlwind of yest...
posts.content:
As I sit here, reflecting on the whirlwind of yesterday, I can't help but feel a sense of renewed purpose. The invitation from Media Mantra was a pleasant surprise, and the experience turned out to be far more enriching than I had anticipated. The moment I entered the office, I was asked to remove my shoes and was provided with a designated rack. This thoughtful detail immediately impressed me, as it demonstrated the company's commitment to cleanliness and hygiene. The carpet-covered office was impeccably maintained a stark contrast to the dusty, germ-ridden environments often associated with carpeted workplaces."
""
"Udit Sagar Pathak's office was a stark contrast to the traditional corporate environments to which I'm accustomed. The open-plan layout, the emphasis on collaboration, and the palpable energy of the young team created a stimulating atmosphere. It was refreshing to see a company that valued creativity and innovation so highly."
"The session itself was a highlight. While I initially felt a bit apprehensive about speaking to a group of strangers, the audience's enthusiasm and engagement quickly put me at ease. The interactive format allowed me to share my experiences and insights meaningfully, and the thoughtful questions and comments heartened me."
"I'm particularly grateful to Udit Sagar Pathak and Pooja Pathak for giving me this wonderful opportunity to rediscover my passion for public speaking. For the past four years, I had fallen out of the habit of speaking publicly, but their invitation reignited that spark within me. I feel truly obliged to them for their support and encouragement."
"Rahul Dev Mehta, the CEO of Media Mantra, actively participated in the session and fostered an open and engaging environment. His efforts to encourage participants to ask questions contributed to the event's overall success. Ms Rekha Gehani who was the HR head one of the sweetest personality i met in my life and she behaved like a true HR head just keeping her away from the talk and made sure that everyone participate in the question answer session."
"This experience has reignited my passion for public speaking and reminded me of the value of sharing my knowledge with others. I'm excited to see where this new chapter will lead."
"#kunwersachdev #mediamantra #motivation #leadership #motivationaltalk

posts.title:
Gurgaon's Rainy Season: A Double-Edged Sword"
"Gur...
posts.content:
Gurgaon's Rainy Season: A Double-Edged Sword"
"Gurgaon, a bustling metropolis, transforms into a picturesque landscape during the monsoon season. The city's usually concrete-dominated skyline is adorned with lush greenery, and the air is filled with the sweet aroma of wet earth. While the rains bring respite from the scorching summer heat, they also expose the city's infrastructure vulnerabilities, particularly its roads. Potholes, a perennial problem, become even more treacherous during the monsoon, turning ordinary commutes into a perilous adventure. Despite these challenges, the rains also offer a unique charm. Many residents find joy in the pitter-patter of raindrops, enjoying a cup of steaming chai while watching the world go by. Some even embrace the adventure of navigating the pothole-ridden roads, treating it like a thrilling off-road experience.

posts.title: From the Inside Out: Building a Brand Through Empl...
posts.content:
From the Inside Out: Building a Brand Through Employee Empowerment"
"We took a unique approach to our marketing materials by featuring our employees as models on our brochures and posters. This not only saved us money on professional modelling fees but also had a significant positive impact on our team. Employees felt a sense of pride and ownership in the company, knowing their faces were being showcased to potential customers and partners. This boosted morale and created a stronger camaraderie among our workforce, making them more likely to become brand ambassadors without additional effort. "
"We created employee events such as Sports Week and the Employee Award ceremony, where employees organised these events on a grand scale, and the company provided the money. I made sure that we spent money and let the employees take the responsibility to organise such shows on their own, which created bonding and a sense of pride. When companies spend money on dealer meetings and external events, we do not realise that internal events need more importance to celebrate to keep the employee in tact and happy."
"If some ex employee can share the pictures of the brochures where they have been on the brochures it will be great."
""

posts.title: IBBI Guidelines for Committee of Creditors: A Step...
posts.content:
IBBI Guidelines for Committee of Creditors: A Step Forward, But Valuation Concerns Linger"
"The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India (IBBI) has recently issued comprehensive guidelines for the Committee of Creditors (CoC) conduct in insolvency proceedings. This development comes in response to a Delhi High Court order in the case of Kunwer Sachdev founder Su-kam Vs IDBI Bank and others, where the court-mandated the IBBI to establish clear rules for CoC functioning."
"The new guidelines aim to enhance transparency, accountability, and efficiency in insolvency resolution. They cover many aspects, including CoC composition, meeting conduct, decision-making, and information dissemination. By providing a structured framework, the IBBI seeks to bolster the role of CoCs in maximizing recovery for creditors and ensuring fair treatment of all stakeholders."
"While these guidelines undoubtedly represent a significant step forward in regulating the insolvency process, it is crucial to note that a critical issue remains unaddressed: the valuation of the insolvent company. This was a central point of contention in the case that prompted the court's intervention. Without transparent and standardized valuation methodologies, the efficacy of the insolvency resolution process may be compromised, potentially leading to the undervaluation of assets and suboptimal outcomes for creditors."
"The IBBI must prioritize the development of robust valuation standards to complement these new CoC guidelines. This will ensure that the insolvency framework comprehensively addresses the challenges that creditors and other stakeholders face, ultimately contributing to a healthier business environment.

posts.title: This article is about entrepreneurs and the public...
posts.content:
This article is about entrepreneurs and the public at large. I tried to highlight the law surrounding company insolvency, specifically the valuation process once the company is admitted into insolvency. I ran Su-kam Power Systems Ltd for 30 years and gone through the process of liquidation of Su-kam. "
"A Landmark Judgment on COC Conduct"
"The Delhi High Court's verdict in the case of Kunwer Sachdev vs. IDBI Bank and Ors. is indeed a significant development in the Indian insolvency landscape."
"Key Points from the Judgment"
" * Lack of COC Guidelines: The court highlighted the absence of specific guidelines governing the conduct of the Committee of Creditors (COC) under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC)."
" * Erosion of Company Value: The judgment emphasized the potential for company value erosion during the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) due to the actions or inactions of the COC."
" * Need for COC Guidelines: Recognizing the importance of ensuring fair and efficient insolvency proceedings, the court directed the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India (IBBI) to formulate a code of conduct for COCs.

posts.title: The High Court of Delhi gave the judgment in my ca...
posts.content:
The High Court of Delhi gave the judgment in my case where they found that the COC in the case of Su-kam made the company from 300 Cr to 10 Cr and ordered the IBBI to make the guidelines for the COC how to handle the company once they take over in the NCLT process. This has been a significant relief to me personally as the Delhi high court accepted my writ petition and delivered the judgement in which the eight banks, RBI, and IBBI were party. I'm pleased to attach the news that the High Court has accepted my pleas and directed the IBBI to make the process and systems to regulate COC in the next three months. So, the company I built with my blood and sweat, Su-kam, was sold by the banks at an unjustified price, and all the blame was on me. By this judgement, my pride was given back to me by the High Court, declaring that banks were at fault for dealing with Su-kam Power Systems Ltd as the company was destroyed during the CIRP period."

posts.title: The Startup Su-vastika got its first Technology pa...
posts.content: The Startup Su-vastika got its first Technology patent granted in the field of storage power in 3 phase UPS/Inverter Technology. Already filed 35 Technology Patents out of which first technology patent granted. Thanks team Su-vastika and all the vendors and customers supporting the company.

posts.title: Dumping takes place if the export price of a produ...
posts.content: Dumping takes place if the export price of a product is less than the normal value prevailing in the exporter‚Äôs country. In order to offset the adverse effects of dumped imports, Domestic Industry can avail the trade defence measures provided under The Customs Tariff Act, 1975, The Customs Tariff (Identification, Assessment & Collection of Anti-Dumping Duty on Dumped Articles and for Determination of Injury) Rules, 1995.

posts.title: The government proposes to implement an action pla...
posts.content:
The government proposes to implement an action plan to minimise electricity consumption and to promote energy efficient appliances."
""
"It is implementing policies/programmes during the 12th Five Year Plan to promote energy efficiency and also implement activities under National Mission for Enhanced Energy Efficiency (NMEEE) to minimise electricity consumption. To promote use of energy efficient appliances, Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) initiated Standard & Labeling (S&L) Programme during 11th Five Year Plan. The key objectives of the S&L Programme is to label energy consuming appliances on the basis of their energy consumption data so as to provide an informed choice to the consumers about energy and cost saving potential of the household and other appliances.
